Key Match Events: Dallas closed the first half on an 11-0 scoring run to take a 55-50 lead
Dallas out-rebounded the Lakers 44-33 and with 11 offensive rebounds managed 15 second-chance points to the Lakers' seven
Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks announced on Monday that Kyrie Irving would be sidelined for some time with a lower back sprain
The Mavs had gone 1-5 since losing Luka Doncic to a calf strain on Christmas Day
Post-Match Reflections: Grimes told broadcaster TNT, "We knew we had to get back on track. Came out with the right mindset after dropping five in a row, so good to get back on track."

Lakers coach JJ Redick said, "In terms of the energy, It felt like we played a little tired tonight. When you're on the road and the other team is banging threes it can be a little deflating to the overall energy."
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dallas bumped the Lakers from fifth place in the Western Conference

Anthony Edwards scored 32 points with nine rebounds to lead the Minnesota Timberwolves to a 104-97 victory over the Pelicans, spoiling Pels star Zion Williamson's return from a two-month injury absence
Others: The Dallas Mavericks won 118-97 against the Los Angeles Lakers
LeBron James scored 18 points, 10 boards and eight assists
Anthony Davis scored 21 points and pulled down 12 rebounds for the Lakers
